author: Christopher Mims
title: How the Internet Is Changing Life for the World’s Poorest People (Smartphones Optional) - WSJ
text:
One of the internet’s most important qualities is that it slashes transaction costs to a bare minimum. What has followed is a remarkable development: It is becoming cost-effective, even profitable, to serve the world’s poorest two billion people—whether they are online or not.

Entrepreneurs are devising new services to provide neighborhood-scale renewable energy and clean water, gas cooking-stoves, microloans for consumer goods and insurance against natural disasters. The enablers are mobile money, the internet of things,... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
